summary: Lisa Su is the chairwoman and CEO of Advanced Micro Devices(AMD) Su took the stage at the chipmaker's recent "Advancing AI" developers conference . Su: "At AMD, we're really focused on pushing the boundaries of high performance and adaptive computing"  AMD's MI350 chip series are faster than Nvidia's counterparts and represent major gains over earlier versions . The MI355 chips, which started shipping earlier this month, are 35 times faster than predecessors . AMD remains a distant second to Nvidia in AI accelerators .  AMD says the MI355 outperforms Nvidia’s B200 and GB200 products when it comes to running AI software . Purchasers will pay significantly less than they would versus Nvidia, AMD said . AMD shares are down 4.1% this year and off nearly 28% from a year ago .  Cowen analyst Joshua Buchalter said AMD was "laying important groundwork to more effectively participate in the AI [total addressable market]” He added that AMD was "[still] a ‘show-me’ story, but one we’re confident in”  AMD Instinct customer list expanded from Meta Platforms(META), Oracle(ORCL)and Microsoft(MSFT)to OpenAI, xAI, Cohere, RedHat IBM's(IBM)software subsidiary, and Humain . Roth Capital analyst Suji Desilva raised the firm's price target on AMD to $150 from $125 following AMD's AI event .  Citi analyst Christopher Danely maintained a neutral rating on AMD with a $120 price target . He noted that AMD raised the AI total addressable market and announced a new customer, xAI, but it did not provide a revenue forecast for its AI business .

Artificial intelligence chip designer Nvidia has been popular among billionaires in recent years . Now, some billionaires are looking to another company that's investing significantly in AI . Nvidia's market dominance and innovation should help it to benefit from the AI boom .  As some investors reduce exposure to the top chipmaker, another AI stock is emerging as an investor favorite . Meta Platforms owns Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp and WhatsApp . It's the No. 1 stock holding of Laffont, as well as fellow billionaires Chase Coleman of Tiger Global Management and Stephen Mandel Jr. of Lone Pine Capital .  Tepper sold 55% of his Nvidia stock and now holds 300,000 shares . Laffont cut his Nvidia position by 14% to 8,545,835 shares . He lifted his Meta position by 1.9% to 3,757,611 shares .  Meta AI is currently the world's most widely used AI assistant . The company expects to reach as much as $72 billion in capital spending this year to support its AI ambitions . The stock trades for 27 timesforward earnings estimates, making it more expensive than it was a couple of months ago .  Meta Platforms could be well positioned to deliver gains in the quarters to come . Investors who have already won on their Nvidia investment over time, such as certain billionaires, may rotate out of the stock and into Meta . The best strategy may be to hold shares of both of these AI leaders as the AI boom enters its next chapter . Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is one of the largest computer memory chip manufacturers in the world . Its shares soared by 25% in January after NVIDIA revealed that it was a supply chain partner for AI GPU chips . The firm benefited from NVIDIA taking a lesser-than-expected revenue hit from US chip sanctions against China .  In late May, Cramer advised viewers to buy Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) if the price touched $80 . Cramer said some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk .

Nvidia is collaborating with key partners in preparation for the next generation of data centers . Semiconductor maker Navitas is soaring on the back of its relationship with Nvidia . Data center equipment maker Vertiv is also partnering with Nvidia, which should boost its growth .  Nvidia expects new 800V HVDC data centers to launch in 2027 . The new data centers will replace traditional 54V DC data centers used for AI and high-performance computing .  Navitas had just $83.3 million in sales in 2024 . The announcement of its collaboration with Nvidia on 800V HVDC architecture sent the stock into orbit . Nvidia believes that the new data centers will: Improve efficiency by 5% Significantly reduce copper demand .  Navitas will be a key provider to Nvidia . Vertiv plans to have its 800V HVDC solutions available in the second half of 2026 . The company was originally part ofEmerson Electric but was sold to private equity in 2016 .  Vertiv looks set for substantial growth in the coming years . Wall Street analyst expectations are for mid-teens revenue growth through 2027 . The drive toward the new generation of data centers promises to create an expansion in Vertiv's total addressable market . Retail investors should focus on the long term. Long-term investing is easier to get right and allows investors to be early to promising opportunities . This artificial intelligence (AI) stock has multibagger potential, and the valuation is somewhat reasonable in the high-flying sector .  Nebius builds data centers specifically aimed at helping customers launch AI solutions . The company's data centers purchase graphics processing units (GPUs) from major chip players like Nvidia . Nebius is now up 70% this year, at a $11.4 billion market cap .  Nebius used to be owned by Russian internet giant Yandex . The company rejoined the Nasdaq in December . Nebius announced that it had raised an oversubscribed private round of financing led by Nvidia .  In the first quarter of the year, Nebius reported over $55 million of revenue, up 385% year over year . The company's net loss grew 41% to close to $114 million . Nebius is growing fast and has expanded its data center network .  Nebius Group expects to become positive on an adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA) basis in the second half of this year . In the medium term, management projects to reach mid-single-digit billions of dollars in revenue with adjusted EBIT margins in the 20%-30% range . The 2025 BofA Global Tech conference offered a cautiously optimistic view of the technology sector . Demand trends appeared resilient across semiconductors, software and cybersecurity . Government-led AI initiatives are also contributing to broader momentum .  Chip design firm Synopsys is still evaluating the impact of new U.S. export restrictions . Equipment suppliers remained positive on prospects for leading-edge wafer fabrication investments . Salesforce cited continued weakness in manufacturing and retail, partly due to tariffs .  Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) saw gains in data protection and security operations . Palo Alto Networks emphasized its Prisma AI security offering and Cortex Cloud suite . Fortinet cited demand in next-generation firewalls, secure access, operational technology, and embedded AI capabilities .

The S&P 500 returned 1,860% over the last three decades, or 10.4% annually . Warren Buffett has often advised investors to periodically buy and patiently hold . Buffett has earned a reputation as one of Wall Street's greatest investors .  TheS&P 500 measures the performance of 500 large and profitable U.S. companies that cover about 80% of domestic equities and 50% of global equities by market value . Warren Buffett, in his 1993 letter to shareholders, wrote, "By periodically investing in an index fund, for example, the know-nothing investor can actually outperform most investment professionals"  The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF has an expense ratio of 0.03%, meaning shareholders will pay $0.30 annually for every $1,000 invested in the fund . The index has returned 1,860% in the last 30 years, equivalent to 10.4% annually .  $400 contributed monthly to the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF would be worth $77,900 in one decade, $287,700 in two decades, and $851,800 in three decades . The current share price is $549, but investors can expect similar returns in the next 30 years . Broadcom is an excellent way to invest in global connectivity and AI . The semiconductor giant sports a market cap of $1.2 trillion and has produced a 373% gain in just the last three years and is up 772% in the last five years . The stock is within a few percentage points of making a new all-time high .  Broadcom is an industry leader in global connectivity and benefits from growth in artificial intelligence . Broadcom operates in several end markets, including cloud infrastructure, networking, cybersecurity, storage, broadband, wireless, and even solutions for hyperscale data centers . Its acquisition of VMware in late 2023 boosted Broadcom's exposure to infrastructure software .  Broadcom's key AI products are its application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) ASICS are AI chips for data centers that can be lower-cost alternatives to graphics processing units (GPUs) Broadcom expects AI semiconductor revenue in the future to grow to $90 billion .  Broadcom is an excellent stock to buy and hold for investors who believe in sustained AI spending . Broadcom offers a comprehensive portfolio of AI networking tools such as routers, switches, controllers . The company's core business continues to deliver exceptional results .  Broadcom is an impeccable business with growth opportunities across various end markets, including AI . But the stock is far from cheap -- sporting a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 38.7 . The company is less of a pure-play company than Nvidia, which makes the vast majority of its earnings from data centers . AI is expected to increase the global economy by $15.7 trillion by 2030 . This is a huge opportunity for one of the leading chipmakers, Advanced Micro Devices . The business is set to supply a leading AI company with its new chips, which could benefit the stock .  AMD's first data center GPU, the MI300, was launched in late 2023 and raked in $5 billion of revenue last year . AMD will launch its Instinct MI400 GPU in 2026 and OpenAI just announced plans to use the chip . The company reported accelerating revenue growth last quarter, with data center revenue up 57% year over year .  AMD is well positioned for this opportunity, making the recent dip a great buying opportunity . The cryptocurrency market was worth more than $3 trillion as of June 12, yet only 7% of the global population uses cryptocurrency . AMD hardware hardware is expected to grow from $106 billion in 2025 to $255 billion by 2030 .  There are strong signals pointing to rising demand for cryptocurrencies over the long term . President Donald Trump's recent executive order to establish a StrategicBitcoinReserve for the U.S. government is a strong signal for the long-term .  Advanced Micro Devices is on a mission to become a leading crypto exchange and financial services platform . This makes the stock a great way to benefit from this booming market . Oracle (ORCL) has just wrapped up its quarterly reporting period with impressive results . Revenue rose 11% year-over-year to $15.9 billion, beating expectations with ease . The real highlight was Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), which surged 52% to reach $6.7 billion . Oracle continues to demonstrate resilience and leadership in both Cloud and AI .  A key driver behind Oracle’s Cloud momentum is its smartly executed multi-cloud strategy . MultiCloud database services used by customers on Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft Azure (MSFT), and Google Cloud (GOOGL) soared 115% quarter-over-quarter . This approach turns would-be rivals into collaborators .  Management attributed much of this backlog growth to major contracts with companies like OpenAI, Meta, Nvidia, and AMD . CEO Safra Catz expressed evident enthusiasm, projecting that Oracle’s Cloud business will grow by more than 40% in Fiscal 2026 .  Operating cash flow for the year reached an impressive $20.8 billion, providing the company with ample capacity to reinvest in future growth . With around $18 billion in cash and short-term investments, Oracle appears to have the financial flexibility to fund expansion without overburdening its balance sheet .  Oracle has a consensusModerate Buyrating based on 15 Buys, 12 Holds, and zero Sells . The average ORCL price target of $192.91 indicates a 3.5% downside potential . Despite the company’s current operational and financial strengths, the market has likely priced Oracle stock too high .  Oracle’s heavy investment in OCI, its strategic focus on multi-cloud architecture and partnerships, and its sizable backlog of signed contracts all point to long-term, market-leading growth that appears both durable and well-earned .

Artificial intelligence (AI) powerhouse Nvidia recently impressed investors with soaring revenue that beat analysts’ estimates . Investors are closely watching Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang’s comments about future prospects for the company and the general AI market .  On June 25, Nvidia holds its annual meeting of stockholders . Nvidia wowed investors once again in its first-quarter earnings report . The company spoke of ongoing strong demand for its new Blackwell architecture .  Nvidia stock climbed in the post-earnings trading session, and delivered a gain of about 6% in the two weeks following the report . The company recently released the agenda, which includes items of business such as the election of directors nominated by the board of directors .  Nvidia's stock fell after each shareholder meeting, but this isn't a result of anything said or decided at the annual event . Nvidia delivered a double-digit loss from that point through the end of the year . Investors react to new or extremely strong messages from Huang -- but they may not reward the stock with gains after a "routine" event .  Nvidia stock a fantastic addition to any AI portfolio, but you don't have to rush into it . The company has more than 1.6 million patents on and around the globe .

The "Magnificent Seven" produced far better earnings growth than the rest of the market in the first quarter . Amazon and Alphabet were the biggest contributors to the outperformance . The index is up nearly 70% since Oct. 2022 .  FactSet reported the Magnificent Seven grew earnings 27.7% in aggregate . That massively outperformed analysts' expectations of 16.0% earnings growth for the group . Six out of the seven outperformed expectations, and five of them grew earnings faster than the other 493 companies in the S&P 500 .  Tesla has suffered from political backlash against CEO Elon Musk, combined with rising competition from Chinese automakerBYD . Amazon Web Services grew sales 17% year over year, while its margin expanded to 39.5% . Google Cloud grew sales 28% with its operating margin expanding to 17.8% .  Analysts expect the Magnificent Seven to continue beating the rest of the market in terms of earnings growth through the end of 2025 . Tesla is the only one showing weakness at the moment, but the group's outperformance isn't going to last forever . Analysts currently forecast first-quarter 2026 earnings growth of 10.2% for the group .  Investors will need to be more discriminating among the seven stocks going forward . Alphabet is currently the only member of the group with a forward price-to-earnings ratio below 25 . Analysts expect growth for the group to continue trailing the Magnificent Seven through the end of the year .  As the tide turns and we start to see more parity in the market, investors should expect a stronger showing over the next year (or longer) from smaller names in the stock market . Many of the Magnificent Seven are starting to look expensive relative to their future earnings growth prospects as analysts' expectations come down .
